c74object.name: cage.harmser
c74object.description: Outputs the notes forming the harmonic series of a given fundamental. A stretch factor for the whole series can also be defined.

inlet.description: The fundamental pitch can be set either as a midicent value or a note name.

outlet.description: The plain llll of cents of the notes composing the harmonic series.

objarg.name: fundamental
objarg.description: The first optional argument sets the initial fundalmente for the harmonic series, set either as a midicent value or as a note name.

objarg.name: number_of_harmonics
objarg.description: The second optional argument sets the initial number of harmonics.

objarg.name: stretch_factor
objarg.description: The second optional argument sets the initial stretch factor.

method.name: bang
method.description: Output the harmonic series obtained from the most recently received input data.

method.name: int
method.description: An integer in the second inlet sets the number of harmonics to be output. If the integer provided is negative, then subharmonics are output instead.

method.name: llll
method.description: An llll in any inlet is expected to be a single number, working exactly like a number message (see number and int) or, for the first inlet, as a symbol message (see symbol).

method.name: number
method.description:
A number in the first inlet sets the pitch of the fundamental note in midicents, and outputs the harmonic series.
A number in the second inlet sets the number of harmonics to be output.
A number in the third inlet sets the stretch factor to be applied to the whole harmonic series (the fixed point for the stretch being the fundamental).

method.name: symbol
method.digest: Set range boundary or chord name, output result
method.description: A symbol in the first inlet sets the name of the fundamental note (either in latin or anglo-saxon syntax), and outputs the harmonic series.

attribute.name: numpartial
attribute.description: Sets the index of the introduced partial. It defaults to 1, so that it expects the fundamental of the harmonic series.

attribute.name: out
attribute.description:
The out attribute is a sequence of characters identifying the outlet types (one character for each llll outlet). Characters can be one of the following:
n (default): 'native' output: faster and more precise between bach objects, but unreadable by standard Max objects (an "bach.llll" message appears instead).
t: 'text' output: slower and limited in size, but readable by standard Max objects. A plain llll in text format is a generic Max message. To keep the representation invertible (i.e., to allow a bach object receiving a text-format llll to interpret it exactly as if it was native format, except for the size limitation), some specific kinds of symbols are preceded by a backtick: namely, symbols containing parens, or containing textual representations of numbers or pitches, or beginning with a backtick, plus the symbols "null" and "nil" (distinct from the reserved words "null" and "nil" representing the empty list and the empty sublist) are preceded by a backtick. Moreover, the symbols "int", "float" or "list" are preceded by a backtick only if they are the first element of an llll, to distinguish them from the corresponding reserved messages of Max.
m: 'max' output: mostly equivalent to the "t" specifier, but no symbol is backticket except "int", "float" and "list" at the beginning of an llll. It is important to notice that, differently from text-format lllls proper, Max-format lllls might not be invertible even if they do not reach the size limit for Max message. This means that a bach object receiving a Max-format llll output from another bach object might interpret it differently from the original, or in some cases might even reject it.
x: disabled output (nothing is output)
p: 'portal' output: only used by bach.portal to intercept the @out attribute specified while creating the abstraction (see bach.portal).
The native output is recommended, unless communication with standard Max messages is needed. Disabling unused outputs can be useful if extreme optimization of the patch is needed.

attribute.name: stretchmode
attribute.description: If this attribute is set to 0 (default), the harmonic series is stretched linearly in the frequency domain; if this attribute is set to 0, it is stretched linearly in the pitch domain.

entry.name: Inlet 1 (number/symbol)
entry.description: Fundamental. The fundamental pitch can be set either as a midicent value or a note name.

entry.name: Outlet 1 (llll)
entry.description: Cents. The plain llll of cents of the notes composing the harmonic series.
